title: Is Yasuo's Wind Wall supposed to Block Darius' Q?
body: Serious question. Would appreciate to riot feedback on this one because I don't remember it being blockable before the Darius rework.

replies.body: Windwall's not supposed to block Darius Q and as far as I can see looking at the two skills in game right now it doesn't. If anyone's got a video, or way to reproduce that happening, we'll definitely look into it, not seeing anything to indicate that's happening though at present.
Yasuo shouldn't block braum's ult.  His Q sure that makes sense. He blocks a fissure in the ground with some wind and makes braum almost bad.

The rule we decided to go with to keep gameplay clear and predictable was that Windwall/Braum E would stop all missiles that moved from one point to another over time (exception: things that go so high they go off the top of the screen). That does result in a bit of thematic weirdness for things like Braum ult or Nautilus ult that feel like they should go under the wall/shield, we felt that cost was worthwhile for the sake of clearer gameplay though.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7rg4eGyb,comment-id=000c00000001,timestamp=2015-08-27T21:43:10.753+0000)
>
> The rule we decided to go with to keep gameplay clear and predictable was that Windwall/Braum E would stop all missiles that moved from one point to another over time (_**exception: things that go completely off the screen**_). That does result in a bit of thematic weirdness for things like Braum ult or Nautilus ult that feel like they should go under the wall/shield, we felt that cost was worthwhile for the sake of clearer gameplay though.

You may want to be a bit more clear with that statement. Ezreal and Draven Ult go off the screen.
Ah, good point. Clarified the original post a bit, this is a pretty rare category of things that go really high (Ziggs ult for example).

If I'm not mistaken there's actually still a bug with Quinn's Harrier and Yasuo's wall. When Windwall blocks one shot at harrier, the mark is effectively useless and stays on him. Its really annoying because Harrier won't be able to be proc'd unless you force it with E, and it keeps showing up as if you can proc it. (It will reapply given enough time, but the mark stays until it would time out normally)

Any consideration gone into making three classifications of missile for stuff like this? high medium and ground? To preserve both the thematic and play concepts of it so the uniqueness of things like these ults or a Zyra binding become a bit more unique.
Please read the Quinn bug below me ;-; pretty pretty please
Probably he is refering to lux. Draven has a projectile, hasn' t it?
Lux's ult is not a projectile. All of her other abilities are projectiles (until Singularity's area is established), and Draven's ult is a projectile as well.

What about soraka's Q as it starts from above the screen?  That seems like it shouldn't be blocked.

Also why does it block zyra's E as that is technically traveling in and through the ground where the wind can't touch it so much?

I think another good reason for this is because thematics may not remain constant from skin to skin. There's plenty of things that would be readable as Braum ult, fit a theme that works for Braum's kit, yet don't use the subterranean effects. Sure, it's weird that Wind Wall blocks a fissure, but it would be even weirder for it not to block something that sure seems like a normal projectile.
but what about twisted fate's cards? especially gold card

You can't block Nautilus ultimate though. I guess it isn't a projectile, but a series of area effects that home in. Got killed a couple of times not knowing this as Yasuo.

And according [to the wiki](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Yasuo/Projectiles) you can't block Tahms tongue lash? Weird.
Edit: The wiki actually contradicts itself when going to Tahms page. Nevermind my second comment.
It blocks Tahm's tongue lash.  It does not block if he spits a minion with W.
Must be the wiki being wrong. Happens.

One thing i find annoying with the yasuo wall, though is for some champs it doesn't block the CC but only the damage, such as for Vel Koz when you block his E with yasuo's wall, the damage is gone but you can still get knocked up, you can also block braums ult, but the slow is still there.
This get's upvoted, yet people still think it's absolutely fine for {{champion:119}}  to automatically drop a spinning axe if he tries aa'ing with the wind wall up.
Veloz~~~~
Will you please give Fizz some buffs?
no one wants {{champion:105}} buffed ever......only fizz mains want that he is still strong and hard to kill
Yasuo actually has a lot of bugs right now, most of them are very easily reproduced on his PROJECT: Yasuo skin.

is it blockable?

it def doesn't feel like a projectile in any way, shape, or form
But aren't we all just projectiles in the long run? Speeding toward the end in this cosmic expanse known is space.

> [{quoted}](name=Koldheartedjsp,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7rg4eGyb,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-08-27T04:23:24.251+0000)
>
> is it blockable?
> 
> it def doesn't feel like a projectile in any way, shape, or form

It may be coded as one because they might have simply thought it would be easier to code it as a projectile that comes into existence after 0.75 seconds rather than a delayed area of effect. Because, in League of Legends, almost all abilities that are delayed area of effects, are also projectiles. (Braum ult, Naut ult, Anivia snowball, etc.) Darius Q being delayed necessitates it as NOT being a projectile. It can't be coded that way and still make sense, especially considering the existence of projectile blocks like Windwall and Braum's shield. So Riot just needs to stop being lazy.

Very few delayed AOEs have any form of projectile component to them, the exception being those, such as the ones you've listed, that are actually a missile in gameplay terms as well (Braum ult, Naut ult, Anivia snowball, etc). All the standard types (Karthus Q, Alistar Q etc) are just zone effects with a delay attached.
I never really considered Braum and Naut's ults to be "projectiles". Kind of considered them in the ground.
subterranean projectiles are still projectiles.

have you ever given thought to making lux's E a delayed ground targeted AOE? the missile aspect's only purpose seems to be looking pretty and making sure that nobody can first pick lux in fear of a yasuo hard counter

Rupture is a delayed AOE that isn't coded as a projectile.

This just sounds like a bug to me.
Rupture is coded the same way Cass Q, Karthus Q, Veigar W, etc. are coded (afaik)
It's static ground targeted though with no moving parts, unlike vel's, braum's and now darius apparently.

(Braum ult, Naut ult, Anivia snowball, etc.) Darius Q being delayed necessitates it as NOT being a projectile. It can't be coded that way and still make sense, especially considering the existence of projectile blocks like Windwall and Braum's shield. So Riot just needs to stop being lazy.

Those abilities are projectiles tho, at least according to the games definition of one.

The way projectiles are in this game is pretty much "an ability/attack that leaves the champion and has a travel speed."


I haven't seen darius since the rework, but old darius didn't fulfill those specifications.


i actually think i remember someone asking about braum/naut specifically awhile back and that was the response given

> [{quoted}](name=Koldheartedjsp,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7rg4eGyb,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-08-27T09:28:14.729+0000)

>

> i actually think i remember someone asking about braum/naut specifically awhile back and that was the response given

Pretty sure Zyra's root is not stopped by Wind Wall, since it's on the group - so I don't see why Braum's ult and Naut's ult would be stopped by it.

Clarification:
Nautilus' ult isn't a projectile. It's a line of AoE explosions that follow the target until it gets hit.

Think of them like smaller and faster Cho's Ruptures.
naut's ult is coded as a projectile because it is blockable by yasuo's wall
Except the fact Depth Charge actually ignores Windwall.
no it doesn't i've blocked his ult everytime i've used the wall as yasuo
Soraka E, Swain W...

So the more I look at this, prior to his rework, it in fact DID NOT block his Q. So this has to be a bug or it is intended.
I even heard yasuo's wind wall blocks sion's ult. I've been trying to find a video of it but no luck.
not true
should pop this in the report a bug section
Bump for interest. Lost an all in because of this earlier and am curious if it was intended functionality or quality Rito Programming.
This has GOT to be an oversight.
Does it look like a projectile to you? It definitely doesn't lok like it to me.... If it happened in game, it is a bug, if you just ask, then, no, it's not blocked by windwall.
Not a projectile, not blockable.
it is blocked by wind wall though... for some odd reason.
